description.narrative: policy, planning and administration
1. Nombre d'emplois de jeunes et de femmes créés ou consolidés par le projet 2.Volume de commercialisation des produits agricoles en hausse 3. Mise en place d'unité de transformation agricole

comment.narrative: L’île connait depuis le milieu des années quatre vingt, une crise économique et financière chronique accentuée par des tentions politiques. Ce marasme économique qui a entraîné une paupérisation importante de la population et relayé un sentiment d’injustice à l’égard des autres îles de l’Union, a fait de l’île l’épicentre des tensions politiques et séparatistes fréquentes qui ont eu lieu pendant ces vingt dernières années. L’économie de l’île est presque exclusivement basée sur l’agriculture, la pêche et, à un degré moindre, l’élevage. L’industrie y est quasiment inexistante et le secteur tertiaire est réduit au commerce de produits importés. Les potentialités agricoles de l’île sont énormes. Elle est réputée être le grenier de l’archipel et, de fait, elle exporte beaucoup de denrées agricoles vers les autres îles, notamment la banane et les féculents. Le taux de chômage dans l’île est estimé à 20% contre une moyenne nationale de 14% et le taux de pauvreté monétaire y est de 49,1% contre 45% pour l’ensemble des Comores.
Le projet est operationnellement clos
Le projet est operationnellement clos
Le projet est operationnellement clos
Le projet est operationnellement clos

comment.narrative: Un état de lieux de l'environnement sécuritaire et une analyse de la situation des équipements informatiques au CNTDE sont réalisées et des solutions sont proposées.

Des travaux de réhabilitation d'une partie du bâtiment abritant le CNTDE sont réalisés et un diagnostic de l'ensemble des matériels et équipements informatiques du Centre établi. Des travaux de renforcement de la sécurité des installations électriques ainsi que des travaux e génie civile destinés à renforcer l’étanchéité de certains murs et du toit ont été effectué. De même, tous les équipements informatiques notamment les serveurs défaillants ont été réparés et ont fait l'objet d'une mission d'un consultant national à Copenhague (Danemark) dans la perspective d'aider le Gouvernement à disposer d'un CNTDE totalement opérationnel pour les élections législatives et municipales de 2015.
Aucune activité n'a été réalisée en 2016 et le projet est opérationnellement clos.
Aucune activité n'a été réalisée en 2016 et le projet est opérationnellement clos.

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness
1. La Politique nationale de sécurité est adoptée 2. Nombre d'infrastructures de sécurité et de défense construites ou réhabilitées

comment.narrative: 1. Un draft de politique nationale de sécurité (PNS) et d’un plan de développement de la police nationale 2. 1

1. Finalisation du Livre vert de la défense et de la sécurité de l'Union des Comores 2. Finalisation des infrastructures de défense et de sécurité comprenant la réhabilitation de la caserne d'Ongoni (Anjouan), le Commissariat central de la Police nationale à Anjouan, les infrastructures annexes de l'Ecole nationale de la Police et deux brigades de la police nationale à Hoani (Mohéli) et Chindini (Grande Comore)

1. Le Livre vert de la défense et de la sécurité de l'Union des Comores est édité en 100 exemplaires et vulgarisé 2. 5 'infrastructures de sécurité et de défense sont construites ou réhabilitées à l'échelle du pays.

Finalisation des infrastructures de défense et de sécurité comprenant la réhabilitation de la caserne d'Ongoni (Anjouan), le Commissariat central de la Police nationale à Anjouan, les infrastructures annexes de l'Ecole nationale de la Police et les deux brigades de la police nationale à Hoani (Mohéli) et Chindini (Grande Comore)

L'essentiel des infrastructures de défense et de sécurité comprenant la réhabilitation de la caserne d'Ongoni (Anjouan), le Commissariat central de la Police nationale à Anjouan, les infrastructures annexes de l'Ecole nationale de la Police et les deux brigades de la police nationale à Hoani (Mohéli) sont finalisées. Seule la brigade de la police nationale à Chindini demeure à ce stade inachevée.

description.narrative: Couverture géographique et en bénéficiaires des services agro-météorologiques et de vulgarisation de l’adaptation au changement climatique dans l’agriculture (en % des communautés et des producteurs ciblés – hommes et femmes- bénéficiant de l’accès à l’information et à au moins 2 technologies d’adaptation)

comment.narrative: A déterminer par étude de situation de référence

-Les cadres stratégiques existant aux niveaux national et insulaire intègrent l'évaluation des risques liés au changement climatique dans le secteur de l'agriculture, y compris des cibles et approches appropriés en vue de renforcer la résilience -Les institutions de gestion et d’appui agricoles sont dotées des connaissances et des capacités en vue de réduire la vulnérabilité des systèmes de production agricole au changement et à la variabilité climatiques -Un système adapté est en place pour collecter, rassembler, interpréter, stocker et diffuser les données sur les conditions agro-météorologiques pertinentes pour l’adaptation au changement et aux aléas climatiques -Un système participatif est en place pour assurer la dissémination de techniques et pratiques agricoles et d’élevage reproductibles augmentant la résilience des systèmes de production au changement et à la variabilité climatiques dans les 6 régions pilotes -Des Infrastructures communautaires durables et reproductibles sont établies pour lutter contre l’érosion, collecter l’eau de pluie et permettre la micro irrigation sur des sites appropriés -Les CRDE facilitent des partenariats permettant de fournir des services de vulgarisation et d’appui pour l’adaptation aux changements climatiques des systèmes de production vulnérables sur l’ensemble des sites du projet

-Participation du projet à l'intégration des actions d'adaptation aux changements climatique dans le plan d'action prioritaire de la SCA2D (Stratégie de Croissance Accélérée et de Développement Durable 2015-2019) - Des formations sur le système d'information et les pratiques d'adaptation aux changements climatiques ont été réalisée au niveau des Centre Ruraux de Développement Economiques (CRDE) afin de réduire la vulnérabilité des systèmes de production face aux changements climatiques - Quatre stations agrométéorologiques automatiques ont été installées au niveau des trois îles pour collecter les infrormations agrométéorologiques permettant de mieux s'adapter aux changements climatiques - Un système participatif a été mis en place avec l'identification de 25 paysans formateurs et 1566 paysans (dont 759 hommes et 807 femmes) dans l'ensembles des 6 sites et le renforcements des capacités des paysans formateurs sur les techniques et pratiques d'adaptation aux changements climatiques. Des techniques d'adaptations ont été disséminées au niveau des paysans telles que le maraichage en contre saison. - Une dizaine de micro bassins ont été construits pour la collecte d'eau des pluies. d'autres micro bassins et citernes sont en cours de construction - Une piste rurale a été construite dans la zone d'intervention de Djando (CRDE de Mibani) pour faciliter l'acheminement des produits agricoles des zones de production vers les marchés

1. Les Centres ruraux de développement économique sont structurés et disposent des outils nécessaires pour promouvoir les actions d'adaptation aux changements climatiques. 2. Le système collecte, de traitement, de stockage et de diffusion des données agro-météorologiques est amélioré pour mieux s’adapter aux changements et aux aléas climatiques 3. Les capacités du personnel de la direction de la météorologies sont renforcées afin de pouvoir bien conduire le système agro météorologique 4. Des Infrastructures communautaires durables et reproductibles sont établies pour collecter l’eau de pluie et permettre la micro irrigation sur des sites appropriés 5. Des approches agricoles résilientes (techniques, semences) aux changements climatiques sont promues et permettent aux agriculteurs de changer de pratiques et de mieux s'adapter en conséquence

1. Quatre (4) CRDE sur 6 dispose d'un comité de pilotage conforme. En 2016, des business plans pour les 6 CRDE ont été élaborés, ainsi que leurs plans d'action annuels 2. - Installation d'un système de prévision synergie au sein de la Direction de la météorologie. Ce système améliore le système de prévision en utilisant des images satellites en temps réel. Ceci a permis à la Direction de la Météorologie d'être indépendant en terme de prévision, mais aussi et surtout de permettre de réaliser des prévisions (cyclone, vents , pluies) - Installation de serveurs et d'autres équipements informatiques (ordinateurs, modems et autres) pour permettre la collecte, le traitement et le stockage des données au sein du service agro météorologique. Grace à cette installation, la Direction de la météorologie a actuellement les capacités de collecter, de traiter et de stocker ses propres données. - Equipement de la Direction de la météorologie en énergie solaires de capacité de 12 KVA. Cette installation alimente 24/24 les serveurs de stockage des donnée et l'ensemble des équipements associés. 3. Deux (2) agents de l'ANACM sont envoyés en formation dans une institution spécialisée au Niger (institut AGRHYMET) pour une formation de 3ans en agro météorologie afin qu'à leur retour, ils puissent opérer le système agro météorologique 4. L’action portant construction des infrastructures de collecte d’eau de pluie et d’ouvrages hydraulique ont permis de quadrupler les capacités de stockage à travers la construction de Citernes de 150m3 , de 19 micros bassins et l'installation d'Ecotanks de 1030m3 (chacun). 5. - Formation de 530 agriculteurs dont 160 femmes sur des techniques leur permettant de mieux s'adapter aux changements climatiques telles que le compostage, les techniques de défense et de restauration des sols , la multiplication rapide des bananiers, - Vulgarisation des techniques de compostages auprès des agriculteurs. L'utilisation du compost a permis de réduire la dépendance

description.narrative: The Union of Comoros has the capacity tools and technology to reduce the vulnerability of agricultural production systems to climate change and climate variability on Grande Comore Moheli and Anjouan

Extent of inclusion of targets and approaches for achieving CC resilience within the agriculture sector in national island district level agricultural sustainable development strategies and plans including cross sectoral targets
Percentage of agricultural support agencies that are implementing approaches to achieve relevant targets for climate change adaptation in the agriculture sector at national and island levels and the associated level of use of CC adaptation tools techniques and approaches by CRDE NGO and community level support organisations at the 6 project sites
Proportion of the 29 farming communities at the 6 project sites that have strengthened livelihoods through the use of new skills information and technologies that address the key agroclimatic vulnerabilities identified at design and the extent to which agricultural value chains on each island have adopted CC resilient agricultural techniques

comment.narrative:
The strategic framework for agricultural development rural development in the Union of Comoros does not effectively incorporate CC adaptation
Key agricultural agencies have low capacity to address CC issues
Farming communities are facing significant climate related threats and have very little capacity and low access to support and resources to enable them to adapt farming livelihoods to address climate related risks

Key national island and district agricultural and sustainable development strategies plans incorporate integrated approaches and targets to strengthen CC resilience in the agriculture sector and national CC adaptation targets for the agriculture sector are being monitored by agricultural support agencies progress is being made towards their achievement
All key agricultural support agencies at national island and district levels have acquired the skills and have access to the information tools techniques to enable them to sustain support for CC adaptation in the agriculture sector following EOP
All CRDE 29 communities local NGOs CBOs POs MFI and private sector groups at project sites are using CC adaptation tools and techniques learnt through the project to strengthen the resilience of agricultural production systems this has resulted in a measurable increase in production levels and incomes at each site and a measurable reduction in vulnerability to all climate related threats identified at design

1 At the end of 2014 the project has contributed to the integration of objectives linked to adaptation within the National Development Strategy Accelerated Growth and Sustainable Development Strategy SCA2D including Introduction of adaptation mitigation to Climate Change activities in different Sectors Including agriculture The project has gone through a review Prepared for different strategies and action plans of the AU level of the different institutions involved in agriculture to integrate adaptation to changes the Climate aspects
2Main agricultural support organizations were consulted and 30 associations of small producers located in the six intervention sites were identified to be supported by projects approaches and technologies for adaptation to climate change
3A consultancy of the 29 communities identified around project intervention sites during sensitization meeting on project objectives and the need to promote action to adapt to climate change The project is supporting the operationalisation of Rural Economic Development Center CRC mainly in terms of development tracking training supervision to ensure that the promotion of approaches and adaptive technology will take effect

description.narrative: Geographical coverage and beneficiaries of agri meteorological and climate change adaptation in agriculture extension in of targeted communities and farmers men and women enjoying access to information and to least two adaptive technologies

comment.narrative: To be determined by baseline study

6 districts covered
29 rural communities covered
4000 farmers 40 female and young to be determined by the baseline

6 districts Mimbani and Fomboni on Moheli Island DiboiniHamalengo and Sidjou on Grande Comore Island LingoniPomoni and Nyumakele on Anjouan Island are set by a Ministerial act and covered by the project
All farmers at districts level are identified 1355 666 women and 689 men in a database as well as there parcels and the type of farming activities

description.narrative: Agricultural advisory and management institutions have a strengthened strategic framework and strengthened capacity that enables them to effectively support resilience to climate change and climate variability in the agriculture sector

1i Extent to which key agricultural and sustainable development strategies and plans incorporate CC adaptation targets budgets and approaches for the agriculture sector and the level of implementation of relevant components of key strategies and plans at national island and district levels to increase CC resilience in the Agriculture sector
1ii Level of access by national agricultural organisations to key CC adaptation information and resources and level of participation in international CC adaptation fora including through regional continental international networks facilities

comment.narrative:
Agricultural Sector Strategy does not effectively incorporate CC risks and adaptation mechanisms
PRGS incorporates CC adaptation but agricultural vulnerability is not comprehensively addressed
Island and district Ag Rural Dev plans do not effectively incorporate CC risk reduction adaptation
No national island or district SD or CC committees
National programming Strategy 20112016 exists is but not being actively implemented
Need for improved coordination between projects organisations as highlighted in SNC
A number of relevant regional continental networks facilities exist however agriculture institutions in Comoros are not currently linked in to relevant regional continental and international agriculture and climate change networks

Agriculture development sustainable development plans are being used and monitored by DNSAE DNEF INRAPE IPEC CRDE to guide support coordinated approaches to CC adaptation in the agriculture sector on Grande Comore Moheli and Anjouan budgets and targets support effective CC adaptation in the agriculture sector
DNSAE IPEC CRDE have the knowledge skills capacity in strategic planning monitoring evaluation to effectively implement plans and strategies that support CC adaptation in the agriculture sector and to promote and guide CC adaptation within new agriculture initiatives
Agriculture and Climate Change Advisory Committees have been established on each island as permanent advisory bodies that institutionalise project ITC these committees are providing active advisory support for the implementation of island level strategic plans guiding CC adaptation in the agriculture sector
The project has supported key agricultural organisations in the Union of Comoros to establish long term information exchange and networking with regional continental international networks facilities and to negotiate support under relevant regional and continental facilities
Resultslessons from the project have been documented and are widely available nationally in genres accessible to literate and illiterate audiences and internationally via a regional international web portal

In order to the set the path for a sustainable approach in agriculture the project has suported the finalisation and validation of the newly adopted Accelerated Grotwh and Sustanaible Development strategy that places reselience of agriculture and communities to CC at the center of its vision
The project has supported the DNSAE to intergrate subregional Indian Ocean Commision Islands network on resilience of agriculture and agroecology The project communication officer will be part of communication focal points of the network Further to that the project has initiated an local network for the setting of a partnership with the WAAPP West Africa Agricultural Productivity Program that was designed with the main objective of improving agricultural productivity while promoting regional integration as instruments for promoting shared growth and poverty reduction in West Africa
A web portal has been set on Adaptation of Agriculture to gather all information and resultslessons from the project as well as all adaptation acivities and studies results at all level national loacl and regional The web portal should be online totally operational by the end of 2015 In the meantime to support those audiences that does not have access to internet a monthly bulletin is being published starting june 2015 presenting majors national and regional events and best practices on agriculture and adaptation to CC A communication strategy has been elaborated to develop information and communication tools for illiterate audiences
Thanks to the emphasys that was given to resilience to Climate Change within the newly adopted Accelerated Growth and Sustainable Developement Strategy SCA2D especially on adaptation to climate change national and regional institutions have taken into account the resilience to CC in their strategies and action plans considering that there will be a need to developp some capacity building strategy and its related action plan this consideration of resilience to CC will enable the development of capacity building of various institutions in the agricultural sector

description.narrative:
Number of targeted agencies
1 integrated effectively adapt their strategic framework
2 count with trained supervisors minimum level 2 of AMAT scale of 5
3 participate in at least an active interinstitutional committee on adaptation to climate change issues

comment.narrative: To calculate for each target institution according to the reference list and the qualification criteria

All targeted agencies have effectively integrated adaptation actions some trained personnel
X trained technicians and managers whose assignment is guaranteed to be determined by the baseline

The project has supported the DNSAE National Directirate of Agrcilutural Stratgies and livestocks and the DGEF General Directiorate of Environment and Forestry in the initiation and the launch of the PNANAP process that takes into account the strengthening of the capacities of targeted agencies in terms of CC and adaptations measures
At the end of the year 2015 4th quarter the project will support the Regional Directorates island in the development of their work plan From these work plans training plans will be developed for training that will begin next year

description.narrative: Climate change resilient agricultural approaches are being effectively used and promoted by partnerships of agricultural support organisations including CRDE NGOs CBOs private and public sector agencies at vulnerable sites on Grande Comore Moheli and Anjouan and key agricultural value chains commodities in the Union of Comoros have increased resilience to climate change

i Level of use of CC adaptation information tools techniques approaches at all 6 project sites by agricultural support organisations and level of subsequent use by farmers
ii level of impact of CC adaptation support tools techniques approaches and effectiveness of partnerships forged between CRDE NGO CBO public and private organisations in increasing the resilience of the agricultural livelihoods of the 29 communities at the 6 project sites
iii Percentage number of agricultural value chains on each island that have increased resilience to CC impacts and have reduced negative impacts of production on the Union of Comoros natural resource base

comment.narrative:
National and island level agricultural support institutions have minimal access to relevant information and resources
Very little information on CC risks systems approaches tools to reduce vulnerability of agricultural practices to CC are available for farmers or agricultural support institutions at the six project sites and very low capacity to adapt to CC risks
Partner initiatives such as the ECDD project PNDHD and ACCE have provided support for sustainable farming systems and awareness raising on climate change in some areas and provide a sound baseline
Ag institutions at national island and district levels do not have the knowledge capacity to actively promote CC adaptation risk reduction
Distillation of ylang ylang is leading to deforestation through demand for wood fuel and is not CC resilient sustainable
Distillation of ylang ylang using wood is leading to a poorer quality product
Opportunities exist to increase value and resilience of products using sustainable and equitable criteria
No certification systems exist for Green bioethical products

CRDE PO NGOs CBOs MFI 29 vulnerable farming communities at 6 project sites are using their increased understanding of CC risks and adaptation options to increase the resilience of farming systems to CC have necessary skills to maintain CC resilient approaches following EOP
CRDE agriculture support NGOsCBOsPOs at each of the 6 sites have the skills information and resources to train staff members and farmers in CC risks and adaptation techniques and to continue to provide effective extension support to farmers following EOP
The agri CC information data management system is fully operational will be maintained by IPEC and DNSAESPSE all key agricultural environmental agencies have access to relevant data
DNSAE INRAPE IPEC and CRDE have the capacity to sustain long term agricultural research and development initiatives that support and promote adaptation of farming systems to climate change
All CRDE at project sites are actively using CCAMP to guide them in effectively working with local partners to plan implement and monitor CC adaption support work for farmers
29 farming communities have adopted CC resilient farming systems techniques at all 6 sites these techniques have measurably qualitative and quantitative increased the level of production incomes of farmers reduced vulnerability of farming systems to the key climatic threats identified at design at each site 80 of farmers using CC adaptation techniques at each site confirm that CC adaptation support tools techniques and information are helping to strengthen farming systems
60 increase in persons involved in applying CC risk reduction and adaptation approaches at all 6 project sites and 50 increase in area of land farmed using CC resilient techniques at each project site compared to project start
Partnerships between CRDE NGOs CBOs private and public sector organisations at project sites involve all key stakeholder groups and are effectively supporting CC adaptation extension support systems at each site and CC resilient agriculture systems introduced through the project
At least 2 agricultural value chains on each island are using CC resilient production techniques
A Green Bio Ethical certification system has been established as a means to increase the value of agricultural products that use CC resilient sustainable techniques and is operational on all three islands
The viability of using alternative sustainable fuel sources to wood for ylang ylang distillation has been demonstrated and a strategy adopted to replace the use of wood in ylang ylang distillation across the Union of Comoros by 2020

CRDE PO NGOs CBOs MFI 29 vulnerable farming communities at 6 project sites are using their increased understanding of CC risks and adaptation options to increase the resilience of farming systems to CC have necessary skills to maintain CC resilient approaches following EOP
At least 2 agricultural value chains have been identified on each island to be developped as resilient techniques to CC using value chains
A Green Bio Ethical certification system is being developped by other projects and CRCCA proejct is working in synergy with those projects on same disctricts in order to aply those systems to farming communities identified on three islands
A Renewable Energy Alternatives to Conventional Ylang Ylang Distillation in the Comoros study was undertaken by the project in parnership with the Clinton Climate Initiative CCI The project and CCI will set 2 demonstration distillation systems 2 different options so as to make final selection of technology to be upsacaled with promoters in order to replace the use of wood in ylang ylang distillation across the Union of Comoros by 2020

description.narrative: Of farmers disaggregated by gender target areas that incorporate practices and technologies for adaptation to climate change promoted by the project

comment.narrative: To be determined by baseline study
4000 farmers including 1500 women have implemented practices and techniques in their operations to be determined by the reference situation

25 pilot farmers were trained as trainers of the project They are already practicing the CC adaptation techniques promoted by the project on site at districts level for a future replication with farmers identified

description.narrative: The Union of Comoros has strengthened its existing national meteorological service in order to implement a basic agrometeorological system in which meteorological data is being recorded at selected sites on each of the three islands packaged into agricultural advisories and used by agricultural support networks and vulnerable farming communities to reduce vulnerability to climate variability and climate change

2i Extent to which accurate weather forecasts are available to agricultural institutions professional agricultural organisations and farmers within the 29 communities at project sites on Grande Comore Moheli and Anjouan as part of a new national agrometeorological system established in CMS

comment.narrative:
Only 4 weather stations are installed in the Union of Comoros
No weather forecasts are available for farmers or farming management and support institutions
No agrometeorological capacity exists in Comoros
No agrometeorological database and related management system is available and operational
No agrometeorological information is available for farmers or agricultural support institutions

CMS has the capacity to collect and analyze meteorological data and to develop and disseminate weather forecasts to CRDE and farming communities CMS are training other staff in these techniques and CRDE in use of weather forecasts
CRDE at all 6 project sites have the capacity to analyse understand and use weather forecasts to plan agricultural activities and are supporting farming communities weather forecasts are being used by 29 communities at 6 project sites to guide farming activities
The 8 meteorological stations installed under the project are functioning effectively are regularly maintained and providing realtime meteorological data at the central level
At least 2 ylang ylang vanilla and clove commercial farming enterprises on each island are using weather forecasts to plan adapt agricultural activities

CMS has set a new agrometoerological service in order to collect and analyze meteorological data and to develop and disseminate weather forecasts to CRDE and farming communities A capacity building plan was developped by CMS with the support of Kenya Metservices
The project has identified at CRDEs level the new sites where to install agrometeology automatique stations in order to collect and analyze meteorological information to be disseminated to farmers and other users as weather forcast and alerts to guide farming activities
4 meteorologicalclimate stations are being installed and technical staff is to go for training in july 2015 to be able to process the stations and use data 4 other agrometeorological stations are to be acquired by the end of the year as well 3 synoptic stations and 1 climatological station
All ylang ylang vanilla and clove commercial farming enterprises on each island have been identified an assessment of their capacity needs in terms of weather forcasting and weather information use is to be undertaken by the end of the year 2015

description.narrative:
Number of agrometeorological products distributed to farmers in targeted areas during the reference period and cover users
Of farmers surveyed with knowledge of the information published and favorably judging the usefulness of information

comment.narrative: No agrometeorological system

The product regular bulletins system early warning notices and climate information for all the Comoros
X of surveyed farmers are aware of the information disseminated to be determined by the baseline

An agrometeorology service was created within the CMS a requirments assessment of the service for filling gaps in data operations including an implementation strategy was undertaken with the support of Kenya MetServices

title.narrative: Développement d’un réseau national d’aires protégées ter

description.narrative: Développement d’un réseau national d’aires protégées terrestres et marines représentatives du patrimoine naturel unique des Comores et cogérées avec les communautés villageoises locales

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
number of additional females benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
number of additional males benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
number of additional people benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions

L'objectif du projet est de mettre en place un système plus vaste et fonctionnel d'aires protégées en Union des Comores, représentatif de la richesse en biodiversité du pays et offrant de bonnes perspectives pour un avenir durable.
policy, planning and administration

1/ Cadre réglementaire et législatif pour la gestion des APs 2/ Nombre d’APs/APMs nationales officiellement créées efficacement et équitablement gérées en collaboration avec les populations locales 3/ Nombre de sites ayant été désignés comme mondialement importants en termes de biodiversité et qui sont intégrés dans le système d’APs 4/ % de la superficie terrestre couverte par des APs nationales et des réserves communautaires terrestres 5/ proportion (%) des eaux territoriales couvertes par des APMs nationales et des réserves communautaires marines 6/ Nombre des tortues en ponte 7/ % des récifs coralliens dans les APMs en bonne santé 8/ Superficie totale couverte en ha des mangroves et Superficies restaurées avec succès 9/ Superficie totale couverte en ha des herbiers marins et diversité spécifique 10/ Distribution des dortoirs (nombre et espèce d’arbre) et abondance de la Roussette de Livingstone à Mwali et Ndzuani 11/ Niveaux de revenus des ménages des communautés locales attribuables au développement d’activités génératrices de revenus (AGRs) compatibles avec la biodiversité 12/Proportion de ménages au sein des villages qui bénéficient des AGRs 13/ Un fond environnementale pour la gestion des AP est opérationnel

comment.narrative: -Un Parc marin de Mohéli, créé en 2001, -Des accords villageois de cogestion ont été négociés et préparés, et des propositions de décret pour la création d’APs nationales ont été formulés et validés techniquement. -Établissement et développement des capacités de comités locaux d’orientation composés de deux représentants de chacun des villages riverains pour chaque AP, en vue d’assurer la représentation des communautés villageoises dans la cogestion des APs.
13. Une description détaillée de la faisabilité technique, légale, fiscale et financière du fonds fiduciaire pour la gestion des aires protégées
13. Étude du profil du fonds environnemental pour la gestion des aires protégées aux Comores

description.narrative: Le projet contribuera à améliorer la compétitivité des trois secteurs sélectionnés en développant les connaissances opérationnelles et le savoir-faire des acteurs, en créant des structures capables d'interagir avec les marchés internationaux.

description.narrative: L’objectif visé est de renforcer la contribution des femmes à un environnement apaisé facilitant à terme la tenue d’élections libres, transparentes, démocratiques et inclusives.

Résultats attendus : Les tensions/conflits potentiels liés aux élections sont résolus par le dialogue et les mécanismes de prévention de conflits Une participation accrue des groupes sous représentés est promue et le respect des droits humains assuré

description.narrative: Le tourisme est reconnu comme étant le principal moteur de croissance du pays à moyen terme, à l'image des autres îles de l'Océan Indien est le tourisme.
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
number of additional females benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
number of additional males benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
number of additional people benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
Ce projet vise à former un panel de 500 acteurs pour que le pays dispose d'un personnel qualifié aux normes internationales.
